articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader.
articles.title: Hezbollah targets Israeli troops on Lebanese border, sirens in Beirut

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: The battle for Erie County, which has voted with the winning presidential candidate for the last four elections, demonstrates the urgency of identifying and contacting individual voters in a campaign that remains stubbornly close.
articles.title: This Pennsylvania county picks presidents. How the Harris vs. Trump fight is going.

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A call by the U.S. and France for a 21-day truce between Israel and Hezbollah "is still on the table," said the top U.N. official in Lebanon on Wednesday as she pushed for a way to enforce a U.N. Security Council resolution violated for years by both sides.
articles.title: Top UN envoy in Lebanon calls for truce, UN resolution enforcement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Milton became the third-fastest intensifying Atlantic storm on record as it headed towards Florida's west coast, threatening to swamp low-lying areas with a life-threatening storm surge, according to the U.S. National Hurricane Center.
articles.title: When will Hurricane Milton hit Florida and why is it so catastrophic?

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Maayan Lubell, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden spoke by phone with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday and the two leaders were expected to discuss Israeli plans for a retaliatory strike on Iran.
articles.title: Biden, Netanyahu speak on Israel plans for retaliation against Iran

articles.author: Abdelaziz Boumzar, Heba Fouad
articles.description: Nearly 2,000 Turkish citizens and family members prepared to leave Beirut on two Turkish navy landing ships on Wednesday, evacuating from Lebanon over fears for their safety as Israel expanded its operations against Hezbollah militants.
articles.title: Turks set to evacuate from Lebanon by ship, driven by safety fears

articles.author: Abhirup Roy
articles.description: Ratan Tata, the former Tata Group chairman who put a staid and sprawling Indian conglomerate on the global stage with a string of high-profile acquisitions, has died, the Tata Group said in a statement late on Wednesday. He was 86.
articles.title: Ratan Tata, who put India's Tata Group on the global map, dies at 86

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The remnants of Hurricane Kirk churned across western Europe on Wednesday, ripping up trees in Spain and Portugal and drenching France.
articles.title: Tail-end of Hurricane Kirk hits Europe, threatens floods in France

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Pesha Magid
articles.description: Saudi Arabia narrowly failed on Wednesday to win a seat on the United Nations Human Rights Council, a blow to Riyadh's efforts to boost the country's rights reputation abroad and four years after it was rejected in a 2020 bid to join the 47-member body.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia narrowly fails to win seat on U.N. Human Rights Council

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian ballistic missile attack on Wednesday on the port infrastructure of Ukraine's southern Odesa region killed six people and injured eight, Odesa Regional Governor Oleh Kiper said.
articles.title: Russian missile attack on Ukraine's Odesa port region kills six, governor says
